moves.1. e4:
I play e4. I am looking forward to playing aggressive for example danish gambit.
The game is only 5minutes for each so we are playing with a lot of mistakes. But this game shows how bad it is to be too greedy or materialistic...
moves.2... f6: He plays f6. I can't remember playing against f6 but it seems to be interesting.
moves.3... Nh6: I don't understand why he played this move! Can anyone tell me what intentions he could have had?
moves.4. Bc4:
Bc4 Allowing myself to castle king side and also bishop is on a very important line.
But maybe i should have sacrificed my knight playing Nxe5 fxe5; Bxh6 gxh6; Qh6+ Ke7; Qxe5+ wining a rock and opponent's king would be in the middle of the board. 
I believe that it would have been better move than Bc4 because my opponent was greedy enough to fall in the trap.
moves.4... d6: So, he plays d6 - a good move. Don't agree? than write your comments and explain.
moves.5. O-O: I played 0-0 thinking about the safety, but actually i wanted to play more aggressively.
moves.6. c3: C3- i was thinking about Qb3 but this move also defends d4 :)
moves.6... Qd7: Qd7 and all my plans disappeared. I had planed to sacrifice my bishop or something but now it wouldn't matter.
moves.7. dxe5: dxe5-trying to open the d file
moves.9. Bb5: Bb5 i wanted him to make a6 and..
moves.10. Ba4 b5 11. Bb3: Ba4 b5; Bb3 - it must be interesting
moves.13. Rd1: Rd1 a developing move and somehow hoping to win the Queen
moves.13... O-O-O: 0-0-0  it's the beginning of the end.
moves.14. a4: a4! a stupid move - because it loses a piece. But as opponent had only 1 minute left, it was worth trying.
moves.14... Bxb3: Bxb3 i hope this won't end as a nightmare for me.
moves.15... Bxd1: Bxd1 and my opponent thinks that b5 pawn is to weak to cause problems.
moves.16. bxa6: bxa6 - a bit shocking move for him. Now he stops to think. He takes his time...
moves.16... Bxf3: Bxf3 - still trying to grasp everything he can.
moves.17. a7: And a7 - i hope he will take it...
moves.17... Nxa7: Nxa7 He was winning but too greedy..
moves.19... Kc8 20. Qa8#: Kc8; Qa8# and he had had only 3 seconds left. But the game was interesting enough to show you folks. Thanks for watching :)
